result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly Lee Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: to any sentence.  Good Time to apply.
Release privileges to the Day Reporting Center with the following conditions:
- participate in Parenting classes.
- AODA assessment and treatment.
-stay substance-free and alcohol-free.
- random urine screens.

Restitution set at $0
Court waived costs due to defendant's inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly Lee Hanson

defendant.name: Hanson, Kelly Lee
defendant.address: 7417 W Lincoln Ave, West Allis, WI 53219

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
As to the amended charge:  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 0 days served, good time to apply.  Court granted the defendant release privileges to the Day Reporting Center with the following conditions:  
- participate in parenting classes
- AODA assessment and treatment
- stay substance free and alcohol free with random urine screens
Court ordered zero restitution.  Court ordered that court costs be waived due to defendant's inability to pay.  Appeal rights given

Defendant Kelly Lee Hanson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Kelly Lee Hanson in custody.  Kimberly Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk:  vk  On motion of the state the Court amended the charge to misdemeanor retail theft under 943.50(1m)(b) and (4)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05 a Class A misdemeanor.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Attorney Alejandro A Lockwood in court, defendant Kelly Lee Hanson not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kelly Lee Hanson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Kelly Lee Hanson in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KOHL'S DEPARTMENT STORE.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kelly Lee Hanson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Kelly Lee Hanson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
